radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild mucosal thickening of the maxillary sinuses with mild inflammatory changes in the ethmoid sinus.

Focus of enhancement, 2 mm in diameter, in the deep right internal auditory canal consistent with an intracanalicular schwannoma. Several foci of hyperintensity on T2-weighted images in the frontal white matter and subinsular cortex bilaterally consistent with nonspecific gliosis.

Extensive signal abnormalities and abnormal enhancement involving the leptomeninges, ependyma, and parenchyma in both linear and nodular patterns, thickening, and diffuse linear and nodular enhancement of the pituitary stalk.
Enhancing leptomeningeal nodules involving the cervical spinal cord and conus medullaris, as well as parenchymal involvement in the cervical spinal cord.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral hilar and mediastinal lymphadenopathy, slight thickening of the bronchial walls, and small retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes.
